author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.
notes: Incredibly relevant even today. The concept of Big Brother and surveillance is prophetic.
favorite_quotes: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.

original_text: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald (2023, Ebook)
title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age that tells the story of millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.
notes: Beautiful prose and symbolism throughout. The green light metaphor is unforgettable.
favorite_quotes: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.

original_text: Atomic Habits by James Clear (2024, Audio)
title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones.
notes: The 1% improvement concept really resonated. Already implementing several strategies.
favorite_quotes: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.

original_text: The Midnight Library by Matt Haig (2024, Paperback)
title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A novel about all the choices that go into a life well lived, from the internationally bestselling author of Reasons to Stay Alive and How To Stop Time.
notes: Made me think about life choices and parallel universes. Beautiful and touching.
favorite_quotes: Between life and death there is a library.

original_text: Sapiens by Yuval Noah Harari (2023, Ebook)
title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A brief history of humankind from the Stone Age to the modern age.
notes: Changed how I think about human history. The cognitive revolution section was fascinating.
favorite_quotes: How do you cause people to believe in an imagined order such as Christianity, democracy or capitalism?

original_text: Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir (2024, Audio)
title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save the earth from disaster in this incredible new science-based thriller from the author of The Martian.
notes: Couldn't put it down! The science is fascinating and Rocky is the best character ever.

original_text: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo by Taylor Jenkins Reid (2023, Paperback)
title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A reclusive Hollywood movie icon opens up to an unknown magazine reporter about her scandalous life.
notes: What a journey! The twist at the end completely blindsided me.
favorite_quotes: Don't ignore half of me so you can fit me into a box.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.
notes: One of the most powerful memoirs I've ever read. Her resilience is incredible.
favorite_quotes: You can love someone and still choose to say goodbye to them.

original_text: Where the Crawdads Sing by Delia Owens (2022, Paperback)
title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story set in the marshes of North Carolina about a young woman who is the prime suspect in a murder investigation.
notes: Beautiful descriptions of nature. The marsh is like another character.
favorite_quotes: There are some who can live without wild things, and some who cannot.

original_text: The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho (2022, Ebook)
title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An allegorical novel about a young Andalusian shepherd who dreams of finding a treasure in Egypt.
notes: Interesting allegory about following your dreams, though a bit simplistic at times.
favorite_quotes: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.

original_text: Thinking, Fast and Slow by Daniel Kahneman (2023, Audio)
title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A groundbreaking tour of the mind and explains the two systems that drive the way we think.
notes: Dense but fascinating. Changed how I understand decision-making.
favorite_quotes: Nothing in life is as important as you think it is while you are thinking about it.

original_text: The Song of Achilles by Madeline Miller (2024, Paperback)
title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
description: A tale of gods, kings, immortal fame and the human heart, The Song of Achilles is a dazzling literary feat.
notes: Absolutely devastating. The prose is gorgeous and the relationship is so well-developed.
favorite_quotes: I could recognize him by touch alone, by smell; I would know him blind.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of Paul Atreides and his journey to avenge his family.
notes: Incredible world-building. Dense at times but worth the effort.
favorite_quotes: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer.

original_text: The Power of Now by Eckhart Tolle (2023, Ebook)
title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A guide to spiritual enlightenment and living in the present moment.
notes: Some good insights on mindfulness, though repetitive at times.
favorite_quotes: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: The enchanting tale of Circe, the goddess of sorcery in Greek mythology.
notes: Miller does it again! Circe's character development is masterful.
favorite_quotes: But in a solitary life, there are rare moments when another soul dips near yours.
